channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don’t count on an inheritance: Baby boomers are hanging on to their money
item.description: How to tell your children you plan to “die with zero.”

item.title: How this Honda factory in Indiana became an unwitting political football

item.title: Can media-company spinoffs of brands like CNN and CNBC be good for investors? Here’s what history tells us.
item.description: Recent corporate media spinoffs have been a mixed bag, with many failing due to the way they were set up, Wall Street analysts say.

item.title: What on earth is going on with the American consumer?
item.description: U.S. workers are not sure whether to buy that new car — or brace for a recession.

item.title: U.S. manufacturers get little relief from relaxed Trump tariffs — ‘what happens in 90 days?’

item.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
item.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

item.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

item.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

item.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
item.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
